For me i love this game, if your into Survival Horror as they call it this is the game for you! Though it is called survival horror since i have played this game for a while, it becomes less scary, but nothing a little jumpscare can't fix! They regularly update the game and recently added a new killer and are adding a new survivor as of when i am writing this (4/10/2021).
This game is the best when you play with friends in my opinion but if your more of a solo player killer is also very fun. I used to hate playing by myself but thanks to this game i can relax and enjoy my own company. In terms of difficulty, it is fairly easy to learn, there are lots of guides on YouTube and also learning as you go helps too. They recently added skill based matchmaking and a new mmr system, so if you are new, other people within your skill level will join in with you in the fun! This game is %100 percent worth the money, i hope this helped you make a decision on buying this game!
SI

I was skeptical at first. This is not the usual genre of video games I'm into, but I bought it after my partner and his friend got into it. I actually really enjoy that there is character progression, perks,  and items. Each character is different, and the killers are varied and have interesting unique powers. It is really fun with voice chat :) Worth a check out if you like team based games.

Is it fun? No.
Es una costra mal balanceada.

When you play as survivor:
Claudette self healing in a corner for a full minute for the 5th time that game
Dwight who unhooks you in front of the killer and then refuses to tank a hit for you afterwards
Feng Min flickers the flashlight at the killer and then immediately goes down and leaves

All of this happens while you try to juggle looping the killer and doing the generators your teammates refuse to do.

When you play killer:
Survivors are a four stack with flashlights, borrowed time and breakout
They gen rush
They have the one person dedicated to looping you
They pallet save
They flashlight save
They sabotage hooks
Their downtime is spent on generators
They 99'd the exit gate to save anyone who is hooked
They body block
And after all of that they t-bag you at the exit gates

So anyone who says the game is "Killer Sided" you are wrong. Anyone who says the game is "Survivor Sided" you are wrong. 

For the love of god I just want to have a match as survivor with teammates who actually understand the concept of teamwork.

Literally no matter what role you play it is torture. I'd give this game a 10/10.

+Fun game, if you dont take it too seriously. 
+Players need bloodpoints to level up, that way you can unlock powerful perks and items.
+Theres different challenges to do, which keeps the game interesting.
-Blocking trolling or toxic players should be more visible after the trial is finished, took a while to find it.
-More maps with different elements would be cool
-Quite many things are only available through purchace, I wish there would be more options for grinding the same items you get by money by playing...

A great concept and at its heart a really fun game although there are some issues with the meta being incredibly stale. If you play solo then you'll either have god tier teammates or potatoes and some killer powers can be incredibly frustrating to learn, But underneath all that the game truly shines when you want to get your murder on and its great to see some of horrors brightest stars as they all feel unique with individual powers unlike survivor which is really just a different skin.

Definitely recommend if your a fan of horror just be aware that at times there can be some toxicity but just ignore it.

Hope to see you in the fog

I have no idea why I felt like this game wouldn't be fun when it certainly is! I'm still getting used to it and learning strategies and playstyles as well as trying to learn how to play as a Survivor because I do better with being a Killer, but I don't think that matters too much, because there is never a match where I don't have fun. I love seeing different survivors and different killers using their various skillsets (particularly scary killers such as The Doctor and Ghostface who I have a lot of trouble being against) and every match is a fun experience!

El unico juego donde un Asesino sangriento es la burla de las premades y las perk toxicas de los sobrevivientes, si quieres entretenerte en este juego, juega Killer, pero no esperes ganar, el 90% de las partidas el matchmaking no sirve y te ponen con una premade de linternas y llaves de rango rojo, si juegas survivor es microsoft repair simulator, no es culpa de los survivor que el unico objetivo sea reparar y la gente juega a eso, escondidos 24/7 y reparando para luego irse, la verdad no entiendo porque la gente juega este juego de survivor, siendo que es aburridisimo, la unica forma es jugar en premade y ahi te ries y entretienes pero a costa del killer que contra premades no puede hacer nada, por eso este juego cada vez saca mas cosas buenas, pero menos gente lo juega, un desbalanceo terrible, no se pueden probar killers nuevos sin tener que llorar durante al menos 30 partidas antes de tener habilidades decentes que son el 10% del total (con suerte) (por si lo preguntan, tengo casi 1000 Hrs en mi cuenta principal, esta cuenta es nueva para ver si cambiaba en algo, pero juego un asesino de nivel 1 sin perks con rango bronce y me salen premades de rango 1 full linternas y llaves)

Nach dem letzten update ist das spiel für survivor unspielbar geworden

DbD scheint auf den ersten Blick ein Spiel zu sein, was sehr schnell langweilig wird. Gewissermaßen kann das durchaus stimmen, denn die Spielstruktur als solche ist sehr simpel:
4 Survivor sind auf einem Gebiet eingesperrt und müssen, um von dort zu entkommen, 5 Generatoren reparieren. Allerdings werden sie dabei von einem Killer gejagt. 

Warum habe ich aber schon mehr als 400 Spielstunden?
Es gibt viele unterschiedliche Survivor, die ganz unterschiedliche Talente (Perks) freischalten können. Man kann pro Spieler nur 4 Talente aktiv nutzen. Da es aber zig davon gibt, kann man sie ganz unterschiedlich kombinieren. Durch die Kombinationsvarianten sind aber auch unterschiedliche Spielstile sinnvoll! So können manche Talente besser sein, um den Killer abzulenken oder auch Generatoren freizuschalten.
Abseits davon gibt es auch viele unterschiedliche Killer, die wiederum auch unterschiedliche Talente haben und somit auch eine andere Spielweise erfordern.
Zudem gibt es auch Maps auf denen manche Talente besser nutzbar sind als andere etc.

Es wird also schon deutlich, dass die fast schier unendlichen Kombinationsmöglichkeiten immer wieder neue Anforderungen an den Spieler stellen! Der mit Abstand größte PLUSPUNKT ist für mich aber das zusammen spielen mit Freunden! In meinem Freundeskreis ist DbD zu einer netten Abendveranstaltung geworden. 

Wenn DU also ein Spiel suchst, was DU mit Freunden zusammen zocken kannst, was viel Abwechslung bietet bei gleichzeitig recht simpler Grundsturktur, dann ist DbD genau das Richtige für DICH! :)
